quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Band and Rock
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, john, vocalist. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Your cellphone starts ringing (well, actually playing your favorite 70s tune).  Its one of your friends next door at the 80s house. They want you to come over right away!  When you get there,  theyre in a quandary. See, they have to name that tune from one-hit-wonder artist, Staci Q. It was popular around 1986. Which one was it?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Two of Hearts

questions.question: Which American rock band was formed by Mark Farner, Don Brewer and Mel Schacher in 1969?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Grand Funk Railroad

questions.question: An argument ensues amidst the Fondue, about when the Old School rap group Sugar Hill Gang released their hit Rappers Delight. You seem to vaguely recall that it was released sometime in the 70s, but your friend is insistent on the fact that it was released in the early 80s!  After some debate, you both agree that it was probably released in the early 80s,since thats when it was receiving a lot of airplay. Is this True or False?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Well, after about 3 or 4 episodes of Kotter, you and your friends decide to check out what else is going on in the house. You head downstairs to the rec room, (isnt that what we called them in the 70s?)  Folks are cutting rugs into the Shag carpeting, doing a dance step that was all the rage in the Mid 70s!  What dance is everyone most likely doing?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Hustle

questions.question: Name the American rock band from San Francisco, co-founded by folk musician Paul Kantner in 1965.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jefferson Airplane

questions.question: This song, written by Bob Geldof, was inspired by a tragic incident at Cleveland Elementary School, CA, when a 16-year-old girl shot two adults and wounded eight children on a Monday in 1979.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: I Dont Like Mondays

questions.question: David Gilmour is famous as vocalist and guitarist of which English band?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pink Floyd

questions.question: Which band released the hit song Hotel California with Don Henley as a drummer?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Eagles

questions.question: John McVie was bass guitarist of which British-American rock band?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Fleetwood Mac

questions.question: John Kay was frontman of which rock n roll band, famous in the 1960s and 1970s?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Steppenwolf

questions.question: You see the crowds really thinning at Place du la 70s, so you thank your hosts and head on back over to the House of 80s for one last look!  When you trek back in, you see things are winding down here as well. But wait, someones stuck yet another tape in the VCR (it IS an 80s party, after all! Only, not Beta!) Holy smokes! Its a 90s tape of P.T. Andersons 70s Era film Boogie Nights!  You and your friends are too tired to stay and watch this masterpiece, but on the drive home, you seem to recall that it did have a couple of 80s groups and their songs on it!  What were two of the more memorable Artists/ Tunes in this film?

options.text: Sister Christian by Nightranger and Jesses Girl by Rick Springfield
Safety Dance by Men Without Hats and Everybody Wang Chung Tonight by Wang Chung
Jesses Girl by Rick Springfield and The Breakup Song (They Dont Write Em) by The Greg Kihn Band
Somebodys Watching Me by Falco and Shout by Aha!

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sister Christian by Nightranger and Jesses Girl by Rick Springfield

questions.question: Charlie Watts, born on 2 June 1941, is known as the drummer of which world-famous British rock band?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Rolling Stones

questions.question: From 1966 until 1968, Ginger Baker played the drums for which rock band?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cream

questions.question: Ian Anderson  was frontman of which world-famous rock band?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jethro Tull

questions.question: Which American jazz rock band was founded by Walter Becker and Donald Fagen?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Steely Dan

options.text: d in between the moon and you the angels get a better view of the crumbling difference between wrong and right

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Round Here

questions.question: All I can say is that my life is pretty plain

options.text: Im Only Happy When It Rains

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: No Rain

questions.question: How long is the weekend in the song Weekend by the Black Eyed Peas?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 4 days

questions.question: Which one of these songs referring to Saturday was released first?

options.text: Saturday Nights Alright For Fighting by Elton John
Someday Ill be Saturday Night by  Bon Jovi

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Saturday Nights Alright For Fighting by Elton John

questions.question: This English singer and multi-talented performer released the 1999 song Thursdays Child featuring the memorable lyrics:
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: David Bowie

questions.question: Finish the lyrics of this 1992 song by the Cure, with a phrase which is also the title of the song:
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Friday Im in love

options.text: Wednesday Morning, 3 AM - Simon and Garfunkel

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: None of these

questions.question: Which song, released in January 1967 by the Rolling Stones, featured these lines:
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ruby Tuesday

questions.question: I woke up and called this morning
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: My Favorite Mistake

questions.question: The soundtrack of this Broadway musical includes the popular song Tomorrow with the famous chorus:
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Annie

questions.question: Feelin easy like its Sunday morning steak and eggs
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: My Ride

questions.question: Which of these songs appears on the Guinness Book of Records as a song having more than 3000 cover versions?

options.text: Yesterdays by the Guns N Roses
Yesterday Once More by the Carpenters

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yesterday by The Beatles

questions.question: When you tried to tell me
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Daria

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Song and Facts
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, john, facts. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What was the Godfather of Soul James Browns name at birth?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: James Brown

questions.question: Kurt Cobain, guitarist and singer of Nirvana, left a suicide note that ended with a quoted lyric from a song he did not write.  What song did he quote?

options.text: Tears in Heaven, by Eric Clapton
My My, Hey Hey, by Neil Young
Ring of Fire, by Johnny Cash

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: My My, Hey Hey, by Neil Young

questions.question: American Music is a 1991 song by this bass-happy Wisconsin band.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Violent Femmes

questions.question: You got too loco, this aint no joke yo
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Now or Never

questions.question: According to Rolling Stone, how much did the Beach Boys spend recording their 1966 smash single Good Vibrations?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: $50,000

questions.question: Here I lay
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Passenger

questions.question: Finish the lyrics of Trisha Yearwoods song Woman Walk The Line:

options.text: t I dont want to hold your hand
d I know Im looking lonely,

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: to find

questions.question: John Cougars 1982 smash about the heartland, Jack and Diane, specifically mentions this restaurant chain.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tastee Freeze

questions.question: He told a little story that sounded well rehearsed

options.text: The Night The Lights Went Out In Georgia

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Paul Reveres Ride

questions.question: I wonder what its like to be a superhero
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Real World

questions.question: Fill in the missing words from Shania Twains song That Dont Impress Me Much:
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: the touch

questions.question: Billy Joels 1973 classic Piano Man is based on his experiences playing at what piano bar?

options.text: The Club Room in New York
The Windy City Lounge in Chicago
The Redwood Room in San Francisco
The Executive Room in Los Angeles

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Executive Room in Los Angeles

questions.question: Although they worked hard at a roots-rock, down home bayou sound, Creedence Clearwater Revival actually hails from what state?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: California

questions.question: Which of these facts about The King, Elvis Presley, is NOT true?

options.text: He grew up idolizing Captain Marvel and patterned his look and stage moves after the superhero.
He was a devout Buddhist at the end of his life.
Richard Nixon appointed him a Federal Agent At Large.
He had a twin brother who died at birth.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He was a devout Buddhist at the end of his life.

questions.question: In 1973, Bruce Springsteen released his debut Greetings from Asbury Park, NJ album with its famous postcard cover. But Springsteen is not from Asbury Park; what New Jersey burg gave us the Boss?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Freehold

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

options.text: swer: New Age music that would make Elvis, Hendrix and Joplin turn over in their graves in unison.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: John Tesh

questions.question: When jazz or lounge singers try their hand at rock and roll, things can get ugly. What easy-listening artist known as the Velvet Fog made the regretful decision to record the Donovan hippie folk song Sunshine Superman? [sound clip]
